name: RATillery - Free version
description:
RATillery is a simple artillery game inspired by gorillas. In RATillery, two fireball-throwing rats fight atop stacks of crates in a warehouse.

Carefully written in pure assembly to run even on early PCs, with our without DOS. Also runs fine in DOSBox.

Features:

  • For one or two players.
  • Playable alone against the computer.
  • Bilingual: English and French.

System requirements:

  • CGA-compatible graphics adapter or Tandy video adapter.
  • Memory: 128 Kb (CGA version), 256 Kb (Tandy version).
  • Disk space: 64 Kb.
  • Operating system: DOS is optional (PC booter version also available).

Physical edition:

A physical edition of RATillery, including a box, the game on floppy and a set of postcards can now be ordered from Côté Gamers.

The game itself is a new version with many improvements over this free version:

  • VGA 256 color suport (320x200)
  • VGA 16 color support (640x480)
  • AdLib, OPL2LPT and Tandy sound support
  • In-game timer (those who thing too much loose their turn!)
  • Training mode (get better through challenges)
  • A much stronger AI adversary (for playing alone)
